Class Inventory

java.lang.Object
gamePackages.items.Inventory
public class Inventory extends Object
Represents a player's inventory in the game, managing items and equipment. The `Inventory` class provides functionality to store, manage, and manipulate different types of items, including consumable items and equipment.

      public Inventory()

  • Method Details

    • deepCopy

      public Inventory deepCopy()
      Creates a deep copy of the inventory, including items and equipment.
      Returns:
      A new `Inventory` object with the same items and equipment.

    • clearUp

      public void clearUp(String key)
      Removes all occurrences of an item with the specified key from the inventory.
      Parameters:
      key - The key of the item to remove.

    • addItem

      public <I extends Item> void addItem(I item)
      Adds an item to the inventory. If the item is a consumable and already exists, its quantity is increased.
      Type Parameters:
      I - The type of the item, extending `Item`.
      Parameters:
      item - The item to add.

    • getItems

      public Map<String,Item> getItems()
      Gets the map of items in the inventory.
      Returns:
      A map of item names to items.

    • deleteItem

      public void deleteItem(String itemName) throws IllegalItemException
      Deletes an item from the inventory by its name.
      Parameters:
      itemName - The name of the item to delete.
      Throws:
      IllegalItemException - If the item does not exist in the inventory.

    • addNewEquipedConsumableItem

      public void addNewEquipedConsumableItem(Item item)
      Adds a new consumable item to the equipped consumable items list.
      Parameters:
      item - The item to add as an equipped consumable. If no consumable is currently active, the added item becomes the active item.

    • removeEquipedConsumableItem

      public void removeEquipedConsumableItem(Item item)
      Removes a consumable item from the equipped consumable items list.
      Parameters:
      item - The item to remove from the equipped consumable list. If the list becomes empty, the active consumable is set to `null`. If there are remaining consumables, the next one in the list becomes active.

    • getEquipedConsumableItems

      public ArrayList<Item> getEquipedConsumableItems()
      Gets the list of equipped consumable items.
      Returns:
      An `ArrayList` of items currently equipped as consumables.

    • getActiveEquipedConsumableItem

      public ConsumableItem getActiveEquipedConsumableItem()
      Gets the currently active consumable item.
      Returns:
      The active consumable item.

    • isInEquipedConsumableItems

      public boolean isInEquipedConsumableItems(String itemName)
      Checks if an item with the given name is in the equipped consumable items list.
      Parameters:
      itemName - The name of the item to check.
      Returns:
      True if the item is in the equipped list, false otherwise.

    • changeActiveEquipedConsumableItem

      public void changeActiveEquipedConsumableItem()
      Changes the active consumable item to the next one in the equipped consumable items list. If the current item is the last in the list, the active item loops back to the first item.

    • setEquipment

      public int setEquipment(Item item, Player player) throws Exception
      Equips an item for the player, applying its effects.
      Parameters:
      item - The item to equip.
      player - The player to apply the item's effects.
      Returns:
      An integer status code: - `0`: Success. - `-1`: Inventory is full. - `-2`: Consumables cannot be equipped. - `-3`: Cannot equip two items of the same type (e.g., two weapons). - `-4`: The item is already equipped.
      Throws:
      IllegalItemException - If the item is not in the inventory.
      Exception

    • removeEquipment

      public void removeEquipment(String itemName, Player player) throws Exception
      Removes an equipped item from the player, reversing its effects.
      Parameters:
      itemName - The name of the item to remove.
      player - The player to reverse the item's effects.
      Throws:
      IllegalItemException - If the item is not equipped.
      Exception

    • getNumberOfItems

      public int getNumberOfItems()
      Gets the total number of items in the inventory.
      Returns:
      The number of items in the inventory.

    • getEquipment

      public Map<String,Item> getEquipment()
      Gets the map of currently equipped items.
      Returns:
      A map of item names to equipped items.

    • isEquipped

      public boolean isEquipped(String itemName)
      Checks if an item with the given name is currently equipped.
      Parameters:
      itemName - The name of the item to check.
      Returns:
      True if the item is equipped, false otherwise.

    • isEquipped

      public <I extends Item> boolean isEquipped(I item)
      Checks if a given item is currently equipped.
      Type Parameters:
      I - The type of the item, extending `Item`.
      Parameters:
      item - The item to check.
      Returns:
      True if the item is equipped, false otherwise.
